node.title: Man's lease terminated, home cleared without his knowledge by the people appointed to look out for him
node.alt: An elderly man sits in a rocking chair facing away into a sunlit garden, next to a vase of flowers on a table.
node.description: The Public Trustee is appointed to manage the finances and affairs of more than a thousand Tasmanians but after dozens of complaints, a scathing review finds it has "genuinely misunderstood the duties of an administrator" for 26 years.
node.content:
["The Public Trustee in Tasmania\u00a0has\u00a0misunderstood its role for more than 20 years and is perceived as lacking empathy by\u00a0many of those whose lives it affects, a damning review\u00a0has found.", "The review, conducted by former commonwealth director of public prosecutions Damian Bugg AM, was commissioned by Attorney-General Elise Archer in July after a slew of disturbing cases made their way into the media and to the state government.", "In one case, a woman was prevented from using her own money to buy her family\u00a0Christmas presents.", "In another, a man who went into care straight from hospital after the appointment of the Public Trustee,\u00a0found his lease had been terminated and his home cleared without his explicit knowledge.", "\"A staff member [by telephone] asked if he wanted\u00a0anything from home [and the person] said 'no', \" Mr Bugg said.", "", "
Christine Underhayes and her carer Justin Brown had to fight the Public Trustee to\u00a0be able to use Ms Underhayes' money for Christmas presents.\u00a0(ABC News: Laura Beavis)
", "\"If he was thinking that he was being asked if he wanted anything from home in the short term, that was not the case.", "The report found there are currently 1,300 Tasmanians under administration by the office of the Public Trustee.\u00a0", "The office is appointed administrator if a person has a disability that is considered to impede their ability to manage their own finances and affairs.\u00a0", "Mr Bugg received 71 submissions and said many relatives and friends of those affected\u00a0found the Public Trustee to be \"[lacking] in\u00a0empathy and engagement\".", "
Lack of communication a key issue\u00a0
", "Many in the north and north-west of the state had never met their client account manager and had no idea what was happening with their, or their relative's, finances.", "", "
Former commonwealth DPP Damian Bugg has made 28\u00a0recommendations and says change is needed.(ABC News)
", "When one woman travelled to Hobart to ask about her 50-year-old son's situation, staff called the police.\u00a0", "\"The police arrived and on hearing from the frustrated and annoyed mother it was suggested that the manager be called and the officer returned to the station,\" the report said.", "\"An internal review resulted in a letter of apology from the office.\"\u00a0", "Mr Bugg found, in essence,\u00a0the office of the Public Trustee has\u00a0misunderstood its core function \u2014\u00a0to act in the best interests of\u00a0clients.", "The former barrister said the organisation's\u00a0annual report should have stated in every case\u00a0how it was complying with that requirement but it had not and he could not understand why.\u00a0", "\"What has been seen by many people \u2026 as indifference, poor communication\u00a0and lack of engagement\u00a0may be attributed to a misconception of the role,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"Change is needed to achieve an appropriate outcome.\"", "
'It doesn't get more shocking than that'
", "Advocacy Tasmania chief executive Leanne Groombridge said the findings were\u00a0shocking.\u00a0", "\"The most striking statement in this is\u00a0that the Public Trustee has largely ignored its legislative responsibility\u00a0to empower and encourage their clients to become capable of managing their own affairs and to take into account their wishes,\" she said.\u00a0", "", "
Ms Groombridge says the report's findings are\u00a0shocking but not surprising.\u00a0(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "Mr Bugg made 28\u00a0recommendations, including\u00a0improving communication with clients and families, improving staff training, appointing the Disability Services Commissioner to an oversight role for people with a grievance and reviewing the appropriateness of fees and charges.", "Ms Archer said the recommendations would inform the government's ongoing work to review the guardianship and administration framework.", "Ms Groombridge welcomed the recommendations but said they were not the overhaul that was needed.", "\"The underlying systems and attitudes that enabled this to happen have to change,\" she said.", "\"We need to move on from judging and protecting people, which the current guardianship system does.", "\"We need to start seeing the most vulnerable\u00a0people in our society\u00a0with dignity and agency in their own lives.\""]
